bestBHT.bht: Jairus, a ruler of the synagogue, came to Jesus and fell down at His feet, showing great reverence and humility. His name, which had lingered down to the time of the Christian era, is significant as it connects him to the historical Israelite chief, Jair. Jairus implored Jesus to come to his house, which was located at some distance from their current location. This demonstration of unwavering faith by a ruler of the synagogue named Jairus highlights the magnitude of his request.

Henry Alford: 41.] a ruler of the synagogue: “one of the rulers of the synagogue,” Mark;—in Matthew only “a certain ruler.”
Marvin Vincent: Jairus. The name of one of the Israelite chiefs, Jair, who conquered and settled Bashan.
His name lingered down to the time of the Christian era.
We find a ruler of the synagogue named Jair.
Archibald T. Robertson: Was (υπηρχεν). Imperfect of υπαρχω in sense of ην as in modern Greek. Common in Luke, and Acts, but not in other Gospels.
John Gill: And behold, there came a man named Jairus,....and he was a ruler of the synagogue;...and therefore a 'behold' is prefixed to this account."
And he fell down at Jesus' feet; showing great reverence and humility.
and besought him that he would come into his house; which was at some distance from thence, as appears by what follows.

bhtAttempts.bht: A certain ruler named Jairus, who was one of the rulers of the synagogue, came to Jesus, falling down at His feet in great reverence and humility. This man, whose name had lingered through the ages, beseeched Jesus to come to his house. His request was a significant one, as his house was located at some distance from where they currently were. This ruler of the synagogue named Jairus showed his unwavering faith by seeking Jesus' help.

Jairus, a ruler of the synagogue, came to Jesus and fell down at His feet, showing great reverence and humility. His name, which had lingered down to the time of the Christian era, is significant as it connects him to the historical Israelite chief, Jair. Jairus implored Jesus to come to his house, which was located at some distance from their current location. This demonstration of unwavering faith by a ruler of the synagogue named Jairus highlights the magnitude of his request.

Jairus, a ruler of the synagogue, came to Jesus, falling down at His feet, showing great reverence and humility. His name connected him to the historical Israelite chief, Jair, emphasizing his significance. Jairus besought Jesus to come to his house, located at some distance from their current location. This man's unwavering faith as a ruler of the synagogue named Jairus is evident in his plea for Jesus' help.

His name connected him to the historical Israelite chief, Jair, emphasizing his significance. Jairus besought Jesus to come to his house, located at some distance from their current location. This man's unwavering faith as a ruler of the synagogue named Jairus is evident in his plea for Jesus' help.

Jairus, a ruler of the synagogue, approached Jesus, falling down at His feet with reverence and humility. His name, connected to the historical Israelite chief Jair, highlights his significance. Jairus earnestly implored Jesus to come to his house, located some distance away. This ruler of the synagogue, named Jairus, demonstrated unwavering faith and trust in Jesus by seeking His help.
